source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在羅閱祇耆闍崛山中。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was present on Mount Rājagṛha in Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊！
translation: At that point, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 身有風患，祇域醫王，為合藥酥，用三十二種諸藥雜合，令佛日服三十二兩。
translation: When he was suffering from a windstorm, the king of doctors, Jīvaka, combined thirty-two kinds of medicinal pastilles and made the Buddha take thirty-two taels of it every day.

source_sentence: 時提婆達常懷嫉妬，心自高大望與佛齊，聞佛世尊服於藥酥，情中貪慕，欲同佛服，復勅祇域：「當與我合。」
translation: Devadatta, who was always jealous and had a high desire to be on par with the Buddha, heard that the Bhagavān was taking this medicinal butter, and he was so enamored that he wanted to take it with the Buddha that he commanded Jigui, "You will combine it with mine."

source_sentence: 爾時祇域，復與合之，因語之言：「日服四兩。」
translation: At that point, Jīvaka again combined them and told him, "He takes four taels every day."

source_sentence: 提婆達問：「佛服幾兩？」
translation: Devadatta asked, "How many taels will the Buddha take?"

source_sentence: 祇域答言：「日三十二兩。」
translation: Jīvaka replied, "Thirty-two taels a day."

source_sentence: 提婆達言：「我亦當服三十二兩。」
translation: Devadatta said, "I will also take thirty-two taels."

source_sentence: 祇域答言：「如來身者，不與汝同，汝若多服，必更為患。」
translation: Jīvaka replied, "The Tathāgata's body isn't the same as yours, so if you take more, it will surely cause more trouble."

source_sentence: 提婆達言：「我若服之，自足能消，我身佛身，有何差別？
translation: Devadatta said, "If I take it, I'll be able to get rid of it myself; what difference does it make between my body and the Buddha's body?

source_sentence: 但與我服。」
translation: Just give it to me."

source_sentence: 即習效佛，日日亦服三十二兩，藥在體中流注諸脈，身力微弱不能消轉，舉身支節，極患苦痛，呻吟喚呼，煩憒夗轉。
translation: He then followed the Buddha's example and took thirty-two taels of the medicine every day. When the medicine flowed through his body and into his veins, his strength was too weak to subdue it, and he was extremely distressed and in pain as he lifted his body limbs, moaning and wailing, and in a state of agitation.

source_sentence: 世尊憐愍，即遙申手以摩其頭，藥時即消痛患即除。
translation: The Bhagavān took pity on him and touched his head with his hand, and the medicine immediately went away and the pain and suffering were removed.

source_sentence: 病既得愈，看識佛手，因而言曰：「悉達餘術，世不承用，復學醫道，善能使知。」
translation: Once he was healed, he looked at the Buddha's hand and said, "I've learned other techniques that the world doesn't use, but I've also studied the path of medicine, so I'm good at making it known."

source_sentence: 於時阿難，聞說此語情用悵恨，長跪白佛：「提婆達多，不識恩養，世尊慈矜，為之除患，方更吐此不善之言，有何情懷？
translation: Hearing this, Ānanda was deeply saddened and knelt down long enough to say to the Buddha, "Devadatta, don't you know how kind you are? The Bhagavān was kind and compassionate and took care of his suffering before he spoke such unkind words.

source_sentence: 能生此心，長夜思嫉，向佛世尊。」
translation: That's the mind that gives rise to this long night of contempt for the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「提婆達者，不但今日懷不善心欲中傷我，過去世時亦常惡心殺害於我。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Devadatta, not only does he have an unwholesome intention to harm me today, but he's also always had the bad intention to kill me in the past."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「不審過去傷害之事，因緣云何？」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "What are the causes and conditions for not examining the things that harmed him in the past?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「善聽！
translation: The Buddha said, "Listen well!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。」
translation: I will explain this for you."

source_sentence: 「唯然世尊！
translation: "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當一心聽。」
translation: You must listen with undivided attention."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「過去久遠，不可計數阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提有一大城，名波羅[木*奈]。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time in the distant past, in an incalculably long eon, there was a large city in Jambudvīpa named Pola[mu*nai].

source_sentence: 爾時國王，名梵摩達，兇暴無慈，奢婬好樂，每懷惡忌，好為傷害。
translation: At the time, the king of that country was named Brahmadatta, who was fierce and unmerciful, extravagant and lustful, and who always had bad intentions about doing harm.

source_sentence: 爾時其王，欻於夢中，見有一獸，身毛金色，其諸毛端，出金光明，照于左右，皆亦金色。
translation: It was then that the king crashed into a dream and saw a beast with golden hair on its body and a golden light shining from the ends of its hair, shining from left to right, and all of it was golden as well.

source_sentence: 覺已自念：『如我所夢，世必有此，當勅獵者求覓其皮。』
translation: After realizing this, he thought to himself, 'As I dreamed, this must exist in the world; I'll send hunters to find its hide.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，召諸獵師，而告之言：『我夢有獸，身毛金色，毛頭出光，殊妙晃朗。
translation: After he thought this, he summoned the hunters and told them, 'I dreamed of an animal with golden hair and a wonderfully shining light coming from its hairy head.

source_sentence: 想今國界，必有此物，仰汝等輩廣行求捕。
translation: I think there must be one in our country today, so I'd like you to search for it.

source_sentence: 若得其皮，當重賜與，令汝子孫，食用七世；若不用心，求不得者，當俱誅滅汝等族黨。』
translation: If you obtain its hide, you will give it dearly so that your descendants will eat it for seven generations; if you don't put your mind to it and fail to find it, your clans will be annihilated.'

source_sentence: 時諸獵師，得王教已，憂愁憒憒，無復方計，聚會一處，共議此事：『王所夢獸，生未曾覩，當於何所而求覓此？
translation: After the king taught them, the hunters became sad and confused, and they gathered in one place to discuss the matter, 'The king's dream animal is something he's never seen before in his life; where will he seek it?'

source_sentence: 若今不得，王法難犯，我曹徒類，永無活路。』
translation: If we don't get it now, the king's law will be difficult to violate, and we trainees will never have a way to live.'

source_sentence: 論此事已，益增悶惱。
translation: After discussing this matter, his distress increased.

source_sentence: 又復有言：『此山澤中，毒虫惡獸，亦甚眾多，遠行求覓，必不能得，交當喪身，困死林野，且私募一人，令行求之。』
translation: Another person also said, 'There are so many poisonous insects and vicious animals in these mountains and swamps that I'm sure I won't be able to find them if I go far away, and I'll lose my body and be trapped to die in the forest and wilderness, so I'll place a person in charge of their search.'

source_sentence: 眾人言善，更相簡練，曉勸一人：『汝可盡力廣行求覓，若汝吉還，我曹合物，當重賞汝；設令山澤遇害不還，亦當以物與汝妻子。』
translation: The people said it was good, and they were even more concise. They quickly advised one person, 'Do your best to search for it, and if you're lucky enough to return, we, the government, will reward you; if you don't return because of harm in the mountains and swamps, I'll give you something for your wife.'

source_sentence: 其人聞此，心自念言：『為此眾人，分棄身命，內計已定，即可當行。』
translation: When he heard this, he thought to himself, 'I've already made up my mind to part with my life for these people, so I'll go ahead.'

source_sentence: 辦行道具，涉險而去，行已經久，身羸力弊，天時盛暑，到熱沙道，脣乾渴乏，欝蒸欲死，窮酸苦切，悲悴而言：『誰有慈悲，矜愍我者？
translation: After traveling for a long time, he became physically exhausted and weakened, and when the heat was intense, he reached a hot sandy road, his lips were dry and thirsty, he was burning up and ready to die, and he was so desolate and miserable that he said, 'Who is there someone merciful and compassionate to me?'

source_sentence: 當見拯濟，救我身命。』
translation: I will see help and save my life.'

source_sentence: 時山澤中，有一野獸，名曰鋸陀，身毛金色，毛頭光明，遙聞其語，甚憐愍之。
translation: It was then that there was a wild animal named Sawadhar with golden hair and a shining hair head in a mountain swamp. When he heard its words, he took pity on it.

source_sentence: 身入冷泉，來至其所，以身裹抱，小還有力，將至水所，為其洗浴，行拾菓蓏，來與食之。
translation: He plunged into a cold spring, came to him, wrapped himself in his arms, returned with his small body and strength, went to the water, gave him a bath, and picked up fruit and drink on his way to give him food.

source_sentence: 體既平復，而自念言：『覩此奇獸，毛色光明，是我大王所須之者；然我垂死，賴其濟命，感識其恩，未能酬報，何能生心，當害於此？
translation: After his body had calmed down, he thought to himself, 'I see this wonderful animal with shiny fur that my great king needs; yet I'm dying and relying on it to save my life, and I've realized its kindness; I've been unable to repay it, so why would I want to do harm to it?'

source_sentence: 若復不獲，彼諸獵師，宗黨徒類，當被誅戮。』
translation: If they don't get it again, those hunters and their followers will be killed.'

source_sentence: 念此事已，悲不自勝。
translation: After he thought about this, he was overcome with pity.

source_sentence: 鋸陀問言：『何以不樂？』
translation: Sawatha asked, 'Why aren't you happy?'

source_sentence: 垂泣而說心所懷事。
translation: They sobbed and told him what they were thinking.

source_sentence: 鋸陀語言：『此事莫憂！
translation: The sawyer said, 'Don't be concerned about this!'

source_sentence: 我皮易得，計我前世，捨身無數，未曾為福，而能捨壽。
translation: My skin is easy to obtain, but in a previous life, I gave up my body countless times, never once for good, but then I was able to give up my life.

source_sentence: 今以身皮，濟彼眾命，心懷歡喜，如有所獲。
translation: Now, I've given my skin to help save the lives of many others, and my heart rejoices as if I'd gained something.

source_sentence: 但剝取皮，莫便絕命，我已施汝，終無悔恨。』
translation: Only take their skins and don't cut off their lives; I've already given them to you, and I'll never regret it.'

source_sentence: 爾時獵師，即徐剝皮，爾時鋸陀，即自立願：『今我以皮，用施此人，救彼眾人所愛之命，持此功德，施及眾生，用成佛道無上正真，普度一切生死之苦，安著涅槃永樂之處。』
translation: The hunter then proceeded to peel the skin, and Sawadhar then made this vow: 'Now, with this skin, I will give it to this person to save the lives that many people love, and with this merit, I will give it to sentient beings to achieve the unsurpassed, true Buddhahood of the path, universally end the suffering of all birth-and-death, and settle in the eternal bliss of nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 作此願已，三千國土，六反震動，諸天宮殿，動搖不寧，各用驚愕，推尋其相。
translation: After making this vow, the six rebellions in 3,000 lands shake, and the palaces of the gods are shaken and unsettled, each in a state of shock and dismay, as they inquire about their features.

source_sentence: 見於菩薩剝皮布施，即從天下來到其所，散花供養，涕淚如雨。
translation: When they saw the bodhisattva peeling his skin and giving it away, they came from the whole world to his place, scattered flowers in offerings, and wept like rain.

source_sentence: 剝皮去後，身肉赤裸，血出流離，難可看覩，復有八萬蠅蟻之屬，集其身上，同時唼食。
translation: After they peeled off their skin, their flesh was naked, and their blood flowed out so freely that it was hard to see, and 80,000 species of flies and ants gathered on their bodies and gobbled them up at the same time.

source_sentence: 時欲趣穴，復恐傷害，忍痛自持，身不動搖，分以身施，死於彼中。
translation: They were about to go to their burrows, but they were afraid of being hurt, so they held themselves in pain, didn't budge, and gave a portion of their body as alms, and died there.

source_sentence: 時諸蠅蟻，緣食菩薩身者，命終之後，皆得生天。
translation: Those flies and ants that feed on the body of the bodhisattva will all be born in heaven when their lives end.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師，擔皮到國，奉上於王。
translation: The hunter then carried the skin to the country and presented it to the king.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜，奇之未有，善其細軟，常用敷臥，心乃安隱，情用快樂。
translation: The king was delighted and surprised by what he saw, which was unprecedented. He was pleased with its delicacy and softness, often laid it down, made his mind comfortable, and made his feelings happy.

source_sentence: 如是阿難！
translation: Thus, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 欲知爾時獸鋸陀者，今我身是。
translation: "You want to know who the beast sawdust was at the time, and who I am now.

source_sentence: 彼梵摩達王，今提婆達是。
translation: That was King Brahmadatta, and now this is Devadatta.

source_sentence: 八萬諸虫，我初成佛，始轉法輪，上八萬諸天得道者是。
translation: These are the 80,000 worms who first became buddhas when I first turned the wheel of the Dharma and the 80,000 upper gods who attained the Way.

source_sentence: 此提婆達，於彼世時傷害於我，乃至今日，猶無善心，長夜思害，欲相中傷。」
translation: This Devadatta harmed me in those days, and even today, he still lacks a good heart, contemplates harming it all night, and wants to inflict harm on it."

source_sentence: 賢者阿難，及諸會者，聞佛所說，悲悵兼懷，各自感勵，懃求法要，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，有種辟支佛因緣者，有發無上佛道意者，有住不退地者，咸各歡喜，敬戴奉行。
translation: Good man Ānanda and the assembled people who heard what the Buddha taught were both saddened and encouraged to seek the essentials of the Dharma, and those who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, and arhatship, those who had planted the causes and conditions for becoming a pratyekabuddha, those who had arisen the intention to follow the unsurpassed Buddha Way, and those who had stayed at the stage of nonretrogression were all encouraged, honored, and approved.

translation: (16) Śubhavyūha-nikāya-parivarta (The Dan edition of this text is presented in the fourth volume as Śubhavyūha-nikāya-parivarta).

translation: nineteenth)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇陀精舍。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Jetavana monastery in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 波斯匿王崩背之後，太子流離，攝政為王，暴虐無道，驅逐醉象，蹋殺人民，不可稱計。
translation: After King Prasenajit had fallen into ruin, the prince was banished, took power as king, became tyrannical and inhumane, drove away drunken elephants, and killed an incalculable number of people.

source_sentence: 時諸貴姓婦女，見其如是，心中摧悴，不樂於俗，即共出家，為比丘尼。
translation: Seeing this, the noble women were so brokenhearted that they didn't want to go into the world, so they all left home and became bhikṣuṇīs.

source_sentence: 國中人民，見諸女人，或是釋種，或是王種，尊貴端正，國中第一，悉捨諸欲，出家為道，凡五百人，莫不嘆美，競共供養。
translation: When the people of that country saw that these women, whether of the Śākyamuni or royal lineage, were noble and upright, the best in the country, renounced their desires, left home, and entered the path, there were 500 of them, all of whom admired them and competed for their support.

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼，自相謂言：「吾等今者，雖名出家，未服法藥消婬怒癡，寧可共詣偷羅難陀比丘尼所，諮受經法，冀獲所剋。」
translation: The monks and nuns said to each other, "Now, even though we're called renunciant, we haven't taken the Dharma medicine to eliminate lust, anger, and delusion; perhaps we could go together to the monks and nuns of Pilānanda to consult with them about the sūtras and teachings, hoping to obtain what's needed."

source_sentence: 即往其所，作禮問訊，各自陳言：「我等雖復為道，未獲甘露，願見開悟。」
translation: They went to them, paid homage, and exchanged greetings, each saying, "Even though we're still on the path, we haven't yet received the nectar, and we'd like to see enlightenment."

source_sentence: 時偷羅難陀，心自念言：「我今當教令其反戒，吾攝衣鉢，不亦快乎？」
translation: Kauṇḍinandha then thought to himself, "Now, wouldn't it be nice if I taught them to turn their backs on the precepts and took my robe and bowl?"

source_sentence: 即語之曰：「汝等尊貴大姓，田業七寶，象馬奴婢，所須不乏，何為捨之？
translation: He told them, "You are a noble and powerful family with fields, seven treasures, elephants, horses, and slaves that you don't need, why would you abandon them?

source_sentence: 持佛禁戒，作比丘尼，辛苦如是，不如還家，夫妻男女，共相娛樂，恣意布施，可榮一世。」
translation: After observing the Buddha's precepts and working as a monk and nun, it would be better for them to return home, spend time together as husband and wife, and give freely to charity, for a lifetime of prosperity."

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼，聞說是語，心用惘然，即各涕泣，捨之而去。
translation: When the monks and nuns heard what they said, their hearts were confused, and they each weep and leave.

source_sentence: 復至微妙比丘尼所，前為作禮，問訊如法，即各啟曰：「我等在家，習俗迷久，今雖出家，心意蕩逸，情欲熾燃不能自解，願見憐愍，為我說法，開釋罪蓋。」
translation: They went back to the Sublime Monks and Nuns, paid homage, inquired according to the teaching, and then each asked, "We were at home, accustomed to conventionality and delusion for a long time, but now that we've left home, our minds are careless, and our emotions are burning hot, so we can't free ourselves.

source_sentence: 爾時微妙，即告之曰：「汝於三世，欲問何等？」
translation: At that point, Sublime addressed them, "What do you want to ask about in the three times?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼言：「去來且置，願說現在，解我疑結。」
translation: The monks and nuns said, "Let's put aside the past and future, and let's hope that you'll explain the present and resolve the fetters of doubt in me."

source_sentence: 微妙告曰：「夫婬欲者，譬如盛火燒于山澤，蔓莚滋甚，所傷彌廣，人坐婬欲，更相賊害，日月滋長，致墮三塗，無有出期。
translation: Sublime told them, "A person who lusts after sex is like a raging fire burning a mountain swamp, which spreads and grows, causing extensive damage.

source_sentence: 夫樂家者，貪於合會，恩愛榮樂因緣，生老病死離別，縣官之惱，轉相哭戀，傷壞心肝，絕而復穌，家戀深固，心意纏縛，甚於牢獄。
translation: A homebody who enjoys family life longs for union, the causes and conditions of affection, pleasure, and joy, is separated by birth, old age, illness, and death, is troubled by magistrates, often weeps and laments, breaks his heart and liver, cuts off his mind, and comes back to life, and has a deep-seated family attachment that binds his mind and is worse than prison.

source_sentence: 我本生於梵志之家，我父尊貴，國中第一。
translation: I was originally born into a family of priests, and my father was so venerable that he was the best in the country.

source_sentence: 爾時有梵志子，聰明智慧，聞我端正，即遣媒禮，娉我為婦，遂成室家，後生子息。
translation: At the time, there was a priest son who was wise and intelligent, and when he heard that I was decent, he sent a matchmaking agent to marry me, and I was accepted into his family.

source_sentence: 夫家父母，轉復終亡。
translation: My husband's parents died in the end.

source_sentence: 我時妊娠，而語夫言：『今我有娠，穢污不淨，日月向滿，儻有危頓，當還我家見我父母。』
translation: When I was pregnant, I said to my husband, 'Now that I'm pregnant, I'm defiled and unclean, and the sun and moon are going to be full, in case I'm in danger, I'll return to my home and see my parents.'

source_sentence: 夫即言善。
translation: The husband then said yes.

source_sentence: 遂便遣歸，至於道半，身體轉痛，止一樹下，時夫別臥，我時夜產，污露大出，毒蛇聞臭，即來殺夫。
translation: He then sent her back halfway down the road, but her body became painful and she stopped under a tree while her husband was lying separately.

source_sentence: 我時夜喚數反無聲，天轉向曉，我自力起，往牽夫手，知被蛇毒，身體腫爛，支節解散。
translation: When my nightly calls were repeatedly silent, and the sky turned toward dawn, I got up by myself and went to take my husband's hand, knowing that I'd been poisoned by a snake, and my body was swollen and rotten, with my limbs disintegrating.

source_sentence: 我時見此，即便悶絕。
translation: When I saw this, I was even distressed.

source_sentence: 時我大兒，見父身死，失聲號叫。
translation: My oldest son then saw his father's body die and lost his voice, screaming.

source_sentence: 我聞兒聲，即時還穌，便取大兒，擔著項上，小兒抱之，涕泣進路，道復曠險，絕無人民。
translation: When I heard his voice, I immediately returned to him, took my older son, put him on my shoulders, and carried him in my arms as my younger son wept as we entered the road, which was again vast and dangerous, with no people at all.

source_sentence: 至於中路，有一大河，既深且廣，即留大兒，著於河邊，先擔小兒，度著彼岸，還迎大者。
translation: In the middle of the road, there was a large river that was both deep and wide, so I left my older son by the river's edge, carried my younger son across to the other side, and returned to meet the older one.

source_sentence: 兒遙見我，即來入水水便漂去；我尋追之，力不能救，浮沒而去。
translation: When the child saw me from a distance, he came to me, plunged into the water, and then drifted away; I looked after him, but my strength couldn't save him, and he floated away.

source_sentence: 我時即還，欲趣小兒，狼已噉訖，但見其血，流離在地。
translation: I then returned and tried to reach the cub, but the wolf had already eaten it, and I only saw its blood spilled on the ground.

source_sentence: 我復斷絕，良久乃穌。
translation: I was again cut off, but after a long time I came back to life.

source_sentence: 遂進前路，逢一梵志，是父親友，即問我言：『汝從何來，困悴乃爾？』
translation: I then went onto the road and met a priest who was a friend of my father's. He asked me, 'Where did you come from, being so desolate?'

source_sentence: 我即具以所更苦毒之事告之。
translation: I then told him exactly what was more painful and poisonous.

source_sentence: 爾時梵志，憐我孤苦，相對涕哭。
translation: The priest then pitied me for my loneliness and wept with me.

source_sentence: 我問梵志：『父母親里，盡平安不？』
translation: I asked the priest, 'Are your parents and relatives all safe?'

source_sentence: 梵志答言：『汝家父母大小，近日失火，一時死盡。』
translation: The priest answered, 'Your parents, large and small, recently caught fire and died instantly.'

source_sentence: 我時聞之，即復悶絕，良久乃穌。
translation: When I heard that, I was again depressed, and after a long time I came to rest.

source_sentence: 梵志憐我，將我歸家，供給無乏，看視如子。
translation: The priest took pity on me, returned me to his home, made offerings without fail, and looked after me as if I were his son.

source_sentence: 時餘梵志，見我端正，求我為婦，即相許可，適共為室。
translation: When the other priests saw how upright I was, they asked me to be their wife, and they accepted me as their roommate.

source_sentence: 我復妊娠，日月已滿。
translation: I was again pregnant, and the days and months had passed.

source_sentence: 時夫出外，他舍飲酒，日暮來歸，我時欲產，獨閉在內，時產未竟，梵志打門大喚，無人往開，梵志瞋恚，破門來入，即見撾打，我如事說，梵志遂怒，即取兒殺。
translation: When my husband left for another house to drink wine and returned at sunset, I was about to give birth and was shut up alone inside.

source_sentence: 以酥熬煎，逼我使食。
translation: He boiled and fried him with butter and forced me to eat it.

source_sentence: 我甚愁惱，不忍食之，復見撾打。
translation: I was so distressed that I couldn't bear to eat it, and then I saw Laodatta again.

source_sentence: 食兒之後，心中酸結，自惟福盡，乃值斯人，便棄亡去，至波羅[木*奈]，在於城外，樹下坐息。
translation: After eating my son, my heart was sore, and I thought to myself, "My fortune is over! I've met this person, so I abandoned him and went to Pola [munai], where I sat under a tree outside the city and rested.

source_sentence: 時彼國中，有長者子，適初喪婦，乃於城外園中埋之，戀慕其婦，日往出城，塜上涕哭。
translation: At the time, there was an elder son in that country who had first given up his wife and had buried her in the garden outside the city. He adored his wife and went out of the city every day, weeping on the graveyard.

source_sentence: 彼時見我，即問我言：『汝是何人？
translation: When he saw me, he asked me, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 獨坐道邊。』
translation: He's sitting alone by the side of the road.'

source_sentence: 我如事說，復語我言：『今欲與汝入彼園觀，寧可爾不？』
translation: I told you this, and he said to me, 'Now, I want to go into that garden with you to look around, but could I?'

source_sentence: 我便可之，遂為夫妻。
translation: I then accepted him, and they became husband and wife.

source_sentence: 經于數日，時長者子，得病不救，奄忽壽終。
translation: A few days passed, but then the elder's son became ill and couldn't be helped, and he died suddenly.

source_sentence: 時彼國法若其生時，有所愛重，臨葬之日，并埋塜中。
translation: If that country's Dharma had been dear to him when he was born, he would have been buried in a graveyard on the day of his funeral.

source_sentence: 我雖見埋，命故未絕，時有群賊，來開其塜。
translation: Even though I saw him buried, my life hadn't ended, but then a group of thieves came and opened his graveyard.

source_sentence: 爾時賊帥，見我端正，即用為婦。
translation: The commander of the bandits then saw how upright I was and took me as his wife.

source_sentence: 數旬之中，復出劫盜，為主所覺，即斷其頭，賊下徒眾，即持死屍，而來還我，便共埋之，如國俗法，以我并埋。
translation: A few dozen days later, another bandit emerged, and when the lord noticed it, he cut off his head, and a group of the bandit's followers took the dead body and returned it to me, whereupon they were buried together, just as the customary rule in that country is to bury me together.

source_sentence: 時在塜中，經于三日，諸狼狐狗，復來開塜，欲噉死人，我復得出，重自剋責：『宿有何殃，旬日之間，遇斯罪苦？
translation: After three days in the graveyard, wolves, foxes, and dogs again came and opened the graveyard, intending to devour the dead man, and I came back out and repeatedly criticized them, saying, 'What was the past misfortune that brought this kind of misfortune and suffering in a span of ten days?'

source_sentence: 死而復生，當何所奉得全餘命？』
translation: After dying and rising again, what will be the consecration that will lead to the preservation of the remaining life?'

source_sentence: 即自念言：『我昔常聞，釋氏之子，棄家學道，道成号佛，達知去來，寧可往詣身心自歸。』
translation: He then thought to himself, 'I've often heard that a son of the Śākyas abandoned his family to train on the path, became known as a Buddha, and attained knowledge of his going and coming, so he might as well go there and return to his body and mind.'

source_sentence: 即便徑往，馳趣祇洹，遙見如來，如樹花茂星中之月。
translation: He then rushed off and headed for Jetavana, where he saw the Tathāgata from a distance like a blossoming tree or the moon among the stars.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，以無漏三達，察我應度，而來迎我。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, with his untainted triple penetration, recognized that I should be saved and came to greet me.

source_sentence: 我時形露，無用自蔽，即便坐地，以手覆乳。
translation: When my form was exposed, I had no use to cover myself, so I sat down on the ground and covered my breast with my hand.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：『汝持衣往覆彼女人。』
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, 'Take your robe and cover that woman with it.'

source_sentence: 我時得衣，即便稽首世尊足下，具陳罪厄，願見垂愍，聽我為道。
translation: When I had obtained the robe, I bowed my head at the Bhagavān's feet, explained my faults and difficulties, and asked for your kindness in accepting me as a follower of the Way.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：『將此女人，付憍曇彌，令授戒法。』
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, 'Give this woman to Kauṇḍamī, and have her teach the precepts.'

source_sentence: 時大愛道，即便受我，作比丘尼，即為我說四諦之要苦空非常。
translation: Then, the great beloved Way accepted me as a monk and nun and taught me the essentials of the four truths, namely, suffering and emptiness are impermanent.

source_sentence: 我聞是法，剋心精進，自致應真，達知去來，今我現世，所更勤苦，難可具陳，如宿所造，毫分不差。」
translation: When I heard this teaching, I concentrated my mind and effort, attained the truth for myself, realized what had come and gone, and now I'm in a present life where the additional suffering I've endured is difficult to describe, just as it was created in the past, and it's not different in the slightest."

source_sentence: 時諸比丘尼，重復啟白：「宿有何咎，而獲斯殃？
translation: The monks and nuns then repeatedly asked, "What was the fault of the past that brought this misfortune?

source_sentence: 唯願說之。」
translation: Please let him teach it."

source_sentence: 微妙答曰：「汝等靜聽。
translation: Sublime answered, "All of you, listen quietly.

source_sentence: 乃往過世，有一長者，財富無數，無有子息，更取小婦，雖小家女，端正少雙，夫甚愛念，遂便有娠。
translation: In a past life, there was an elderly man with incalculable wealth and no children who took a young woman, albeit a young woman from a small family, who was correct and had few children.

source_sentence: 十月已滿，生一男兒，夫妻敬重，視之無厭。
translation: When the tenth month was up, she gave birth to a boy, whom the couple respected and looked after without tire.

source_sentence: 大婦自念：『我雖貴族，現無子息可以繼嗣；今此小兒，若其長大，當領門戶，田財諸物，盡當攝持。
translation: The older woman thought to herself, 'Although I'm from a noble family, I don't have any children to carry on my family's legacy; now, if this little boy grows up, he'll take charge of my household and my land and property.

source_sentence: 我唐勞苦，積聚財產，不得自在。』
translation: I've labored so hard to accumulate property that I won't be able to be free.'

source_sentence: 妬心即生，不如早殺，內計已定即取鐵針，刺兒顖上，令沒不現。
translation: With that in mind, he decided to take an iron needle and stab his son in the throat so that it wouldn't show.

source_sentence: 兒漸痟瘦，旬日之間，遂便喪亡。
translation: The baby gradually became emaciated, and within a few days, he died.

source_sentence: 小婦懊惱，氣絕復穌，疑是大婦妬殺我子，即問大婦：『汝之無狀，怨殺我子。』
translation: Distressed, the young woman was despondent and went back to sleep, suspecting that the older woman had killed my son because of her jealousy, and she asked the older woman, 'Are you without any reason to hate killing my son?'

source_sentence: 大婦即時，自呪誓曰：『若殺汝子，使我世世，夫為毒蛇所殺，有兒子者，水漂狼食，身見生埋，自噉其子，父母大小，失火而死。
translation: The older woman then swore under her own spell, 'If I kill your son, my husband will be killed by a viper for generations to come, and if he has a son, he'll be swept away by water and eaten by wolves, see his body buried, eat his son, and have his parents and grandparents burned to death.

source_sentence: 何為謗我？
translation: Why do you denigrate me?

source_sentence: 何為謗我？』
translation: What is it to denigrate the self?'

source_sentence: 當於爾時，謂無罪福反報之殃，前所呪誓，今悉受之，無相代者。
translation: At that point, this is called the retribution of merit for lack of demerits, and the previous spell will be accepted without substitution.

source_sentence: 欲知爾時大婦者，則我身是。」
translation: If you want to know who the great woman was at that time, then this is me."

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼，重復問曰：「復有何慶，得覩如來，就迎之耶？
translation: The monks and nuns again asked, "What happiness would there be in knowing the Tathāgata and welcoming him?

source_sentence: 得在道堂免于生死？」
translation: to be spared life and death in the hall of enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 微妙答曰：「昔波羅[木*奈]國，有一大山，名曰仙山，其中恒有辟支佛聲聞、外道神仙，無有空缺。
translation: Sublime answered, "Once upon a time, there was a great mountain in Pola [Munai] called Mount Xian, and there were always pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas, and non-Buddhist gods and sages living in it, with nothing vacant.

source_sentence: 彼時緣覺，入城分衛。
translation: At the time, the pratyekabuddhas went into the city to guard it.

source_sentence: 有長者婦，見之歡喜，即供養之。
translation: An elderly woman rejoiced when she saw him and made offerings to him.

source_sentence: 緣覺食已，飛昇虛空，身出水火，坐臥空中。
translation: After he ate, the pratyekabuddha soared into the sky, escaped from the water and fire in his body, and sat down to lie in the air.

source_sentence: 婦時見之，即發誓言：『使我後世得道如是。』
translation: When she saw him, she made a vow, 'So that I might attain the Way in a later life like this.'

source_sentence: 爾時婦者，則我身是。
translation: At the time, the woman was this: 'This is me.'

source_sentence: 緣是之故，得見如來，心意開解，成羅漢道。
translation: It was for this reason that I saw the Tathāgata, had my mind liberated, and achieved the arhat path.

source_sentence: 今日我身，雖得羅漢，恒熱鐵針，從頂上入，於足下出，晝夜患此，無復竟已。
translation: Today, even though I've become a arhat, I'm constantly exposed to hot iron needles that enter from the top of my head and exit from the bottom of my feet, and I suffer from this day and night without ever ending it.

source_sentence: 殃福如是，無有朽敗。」
translation: Thus are my misfortune and fortune, and I won't perish."

source_sentence: 爾時五百貴姓比丘尼，聞說是法，心意悚然，觀欲之本，猶如熾火，貪欲之心，永不復生，在家之苦，甚於牢獄，諸垢消盡，一時入定，成阿羅漢道。
translation: When the five hundred noble monks and nuns heard this teaching, their minds were startled as they observed that the root of desire was like a blazing fire, that the mind of desire would never again arise, that the suffering of being at home was worse than prison, that the defilements had vanished, and that they had instantly entered concentration and realized the arhat path.

source_sentence: 各共齊心，白微妙曰：「我等纏綿繫著婬欲，不能自拔，今蒙仁恩導，得度生死。」
translation: With one mind, they said to Weimiao, "We've been so tethered to sexual desire that we couldn't extricate ourselves, but now I've been guided by your kindness to save us from birth and death."

source_sentence: 時佛歎曰：「快哉微妙！
translation: The Buddha then praised them, "How wonderful, Marvelous!

source_sentence: 夫為道者，能以法教，轉相教誡，可謂佛子。」
translation: A person who makes a path and can teach and instruct others in the ways of the Dharma can be called a son of the Buddha."

source_sentence: 眾會聞說，莫不歡喜，稽首奉行。
translation: Everyone who heard what he said rejoiced, bowed their heads, and approved.

source_sentence: （一七）阿輸迦施土品第十七(丹本此品在第四卷為第二十
translation: (17) Aśoka's Land-Giving Chapter 17 (The Dan edition of this chapter is number 20 in volume 4)

source_sentence: 二)
translation: ii)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，晨與阿難，入城乞食。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān and Ānanda went into the city in the morning to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 見群小兒於道中戲，各聚地土，用作宮舍，及作倉藏財寶五穀。
translation: He saw a group of small children playing in the path, each gathering on the ground, using it as a palace dwelling and making a storehouse for treasures and grains.

source_sentence: 有一小兒，遙見佛來，見佛光相，敬心內發，歡喜踊躍，生布施心，即取倉中名為穀者，即以手掬，欲用施佛。
translation: When a little boy saw the Buddha coming from a distance, he looked at his radiant features, felt respect for him, rejoiced, and gave rise to the intention to give.

source_sentence: 身小不逮，語一小兒：「我登汝上，以穀布施。」
translation: Being too small to do so, he said to a little boy, "I'll ascend to you and give you some grain as alms."

source_sentence: 小兒歡喜，報言：「可爾。」
translation: The boy rejoiced and replied, "That's OK."

source_sentence: 即躡肩上，以土奉佛。
translation: He then stepped onto his shoulder and offered the Buddha some dirt.

source_sentence: 佛即下鉢，低頭受土，受之已訖授與阿難，語言：「持此塗污我房。」
translation: The Buddha then lowered his bowl, bowed his head to accept the dirt, gave it to Ānanda, and said, "Take this and smudge my room."

source_sentence: 乞食既得，還詣祇洹，阿難以土，塗佛房地，齊污一邊，其土便盡。
translation: When he had finished begging for food and had returned to Jetavana, Ānanda smeared the floor of the Buddha's quarters with dirt, defiling one side equally, and then the dirt was completely gone.

source_sentence: 污已，整衣服，具以白佛。
translation: After he had defiled it, he adjusted his clothes and presented them to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「向者小兒，歡喜施土，土足塗污佛房一邊，緣斯功德，我般涅槃百歲之後，當作國王，字阿輸迦。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "That little boy who was so delighted with the gift of dirt and whose feet defiled one side of the Buddha's quarters because of that merit will be made king of my country, whose name is Aśoka, a hundred years after I attain parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 其次小兒，當作大臣，共領閻浮提一切國土，興顯三寶，廣設供養，分布舍利，遍閻浮提，當為我起八萬四千塔。」
translation: The next youngster will be a minister who will lead all the lands of Jambudvīpa, make manifestations of the Three Treasures, make offerings, distribute relics throughout Jambudvīpa, and erect 84,000 stūpas for me."

source_sentence: 阿難歡喜，重白佛言：「如來先昔，造何功德，而乃有此多塔之報？」
translation: Rejoicing, Ānanda repeatedly said to the Buddha, "What merit did the Tathāgata create in the past that made the reward of so many stūpas possible?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 專心善聽。
translation: "Concentrate your mind and listen well.

source_sentence: 過去久遠阿僧祇劫，有大國王，名波塞奇，典閻浮提八萬四千國。
translation: In a long, long time ago, there was a great king named Pārśeche who ruled 84,000 countries in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 時世有佛，名曰弗沙。
translation: At the time, there was a Buddha named Vibhāṣā.

source_sentence: 波塞奇王，與諸臣民，供養於佛及比丘僧，四事供養，敬慕無量。
translation: The king of Pārśecī and his subjects made offerings to the Buddha and the monks and nuns, making four kinds of offerings and venerating them immeasurably.

source_sentence: 爾時其王，心自念言：『今此大國，人民之類，常得見佛禮拜供養，其餘小國，各處邊僻人民之類，無由修福，就當圖畵佛之形像，布與諸國，咸令供養。』
translation: At the time, the king thought to himself, 'Now, in this large country, the people of this country can always see the Buddha and venerate and make offerings to him, but in the other small countries, there's no way for the people of each remote region to cultivate goodness; it would be a good idea to paint an image of the Buddha and distribute it to all the countries so that they can make offerings.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即召畵師，勅使圖畵。
translation: After he had this thought, he summoned the painters and ordered them to paint the image.

source_sentence: 時諸畵師，來至佛邊，看佛相好，欲得畵之，適畵一處，忘失餘處；重更觀看，復次下手，忘一畵一，不能使成。
translation: The painters then came to the Buddha, looked at his features, and wanted to paint his image, but when they finished painting one part, they forgot the rest.

source_sentence: 時弗沙佛，調和眾彩，手自為畵，以為摸法，畵立一像。
translation: Pūrśva Buddha then mixed the colors, drew a picture with his own hands, and used it as a way to touch and paint an image.

source_sentence: 於是畵師，乃能圖畵，都盡八萬四千之像，極令淨妙，端正如佛，布與諸國，一國與一。
translation: The master then was able to paint a total of 84,000 images, making them perfectly pure and beautiful, correct like the Buddha's, and distribute them to the countries, one for each country.

source_sentence: 又作告下，勅令人民辦具花香以用供養。
translation: He also made a proclamation, commanding the people to prepare flowers and incense for making offerings.

source_sentence: 諸國王臣民，得如來像，歡喜敬奉，如視佛身。
translation: When the kings and subjects of those countries received the Tathāgata's image, they rejoiced and venerated it as if it were the Buddha himself.

source_sentence: 如是阿難！
translation: Thus, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 波塞奇王，今我身是。
translation: "King Pārśecī, this is me now.

source_sentence: 緣於彼世畫八萬四千如來之像，布與諸國令人供養，緣是功德，世世受福，天上人中，恒為帝王，所受生處，端正殊妙，三十二相、八十種好。
translation: Because of this merit, I'll always be blessed from generation to generation, always be an emperor among gods and humans, and be born in a place that's correct and marvelous, with thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，自致成佛，涅槃之後，當復得此八萬四千諸塔果報。」
translation: Based on this merit, they will become buddhas themselves and, after nirvāṇa, will again attain the fruit of these 84,000 stūpas."

source_sentence: 賢者阿難，及諸會者，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Good man Ānanda and the assembled people who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.
