translation: （The Seven Vials of Gold Giving, Chapter 18 (Danben: 23)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，各處異國，隨意安居；經九十日，安居已竟，各詣佛所，諮受聖教。
translation: At the time, the monks, each in a different country, had settled down as they liked, and after ninety days of settling down, each went to the Buddha to consult with him about the holy teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，與諸比丘，隔別經久，慈心愍傷，即舉千輻相輪神手，而慰勞之，下意問訊：「汝等諸人！
translation: The Bhagavān then, after a long separation from the monks, was kind and compassionate, so he raised his hand in the divine wheel of a thousand spokes to console them and greeted them with a downward greeting, "All of you!

source_sentence: 住在僻遠，飲食供養，得無乏耶？」
translation: How can you live in a remote place and eat and provide for others without lacking?"

source_sentence: 如來功德，世無儔類，今乃下意，瞻諸比丘，特懷謙敬。
translation: The Tathāgata's virtues have no equal in the world, but now he has come down to look up to the monks and pay special humility.

source_sentence: 阿難見之，甚怪所以，即白佛言：「世尊出世，最為殊特，功德智慧，世之希有。
translation: Seeing this, Ānanda was puzzled and said to the Buddha, "The Bhagavān is most extraordinary in coming into this world, and his merits and wisdom are rare in the world.

source_sentence: 今乃下意，慰喻問訊諸比丘眾，何其善耶？
translation: Why has he come down to us and asked the monks about their merits?

source_sentence: 不審，世尊！
translation: Iniquitous, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 興發如是謙卑之言，為遠近耶？」
translation: Does he give rise to such humble words, whether near or far?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「欲知不乎？
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Do you want to know?

source_sentence: 明聽善思！
translation: Clarity of hearing and good thinking!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。」
translation: I will explain this for you."

source_sentence: 「奉教善聽。」
translation: "Obey the teaching and listen well."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「過去久遠，無數無量不可思議阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有一大國，名波羅[木*奈]。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Once upon a time, long ago, in an incalculably long and unfathomably long eon, there was a large country in Jambudvīpa called [Mokṣala*Nāga].

source_sentence: 時有一人，好修家業，意偏愛金，勤力積聚，作役其身，四方治生，所得錢財，盡用買金，因得一瓶，於其舍內，掘地藏之。
translation: At the time, there was a man who cultivated family business and had a preference for gold, so he worked hard to accumulate it, working to bind himself up and healing life in every direction.

source_sentence: 如是種種，懃身苦體，經積年歲，終不衣食，聚之不休，乃得七瓶，悉取埋之。
translation: After years and years of this kind of hard work and suffering, he was finally deprived of food and clothing and gathered seven vials, which he then took and buried.

source_sentence: 其人後時，遇疾命終，由其愛金，轉身作一毒蛇之身，還其舍內，守此金瓶。
translation: Later, when his illness ended, he loved gold and transformed into the body of a viper, which returned to his house and guarded the gold vials.

source_sentence: 經積年歲，其舍摩滅，無人住止，蛇守金瓶，壽命年歲，已復向盡，捨其身已，愛心不息，復受本形，自以其身，纏諸金瓶。
translation: After many years pass, his house is destroyed, and there's no one to stay there. The snake guards the vase, and its life span is years and years before it's exhausted. After abandoning its body, its desire doesn't stop, and it takes on its original form again and wraps itself around the vase with its body.

source_sentence: 如是展轉，經數萬歲，最後受身，厭心復生，自計由來，為是金故，而受惡形，無有休已。
translation: It goes on like this for tens of thousands of years before finally accepting the body, and disillusionment arises again, figuring that since then, it's because of this gold that it's been given a bad form without ever stopping.

source_sentence: 『今當用施快福田中，使我世世蒙其福報。』
translation: 'Now, I will use it to quickly give to a field of merit, so that I will receive its meritorious rewards from generation to generation.'

source_sentence: 思惟計定，往至道邊，竄身草中，匿身而看，設有人來，我當語之。
translation: After thinking about it, he goes to the edge of the road, escapes into the grass, and hides himself to look at it, saying, 'Suppose someone comes along, I'll tell them.'

source_sentence: 爾時毒蛇見有一人順道而過，蛇便呼之。
translation: It was then that the viper saw a man passing along the road, and it called out to him.

source_sentence: 人聞喚聲，左右顧望，不見有人，但聞其聲，復道而行。
translation: When the person hears the call, he looks around, doesn't see anyone, but he hears his voice and resumes his journey along the road.

source_sentence: 蛇復現形，喚言：『咄人！
translation: The snake then reappears in the form of a man and calls out, 'Duh!

source_sentence: 可來近我。』
translation: You may come near me.'

source_sentence: 人答蛇言：『汝身毒惡，喚我用為？
translation: The man answered the snake, 'Why did you call me, when your body is poisonous and unwholesome?'

source_sentence: 我若近汝，儻為傷害。』
translation: If I come near you, I'll be harmed in the event that you don't come.'

source_sentence: 蛇答人言：『我苟懷惡，設汝不來，亦能作害。』
translation: The snake answered the man, 'Even if I harbor evil, I could do harm if you didn't come.'

source_sentence: 其人恐懼，往至其所。
translation: Fearful, the man went to it.

source_sentence: 蛇語人言：『吾今此處，有一瓶金，欲用相託供養作福，能為之不？
translation: The snake told him, 'Now, here I am, with a vial of gold, and I want to entrust it to you for a blessing, will you do it?'

source_sentence: 若不為者，我當害汝。』
translation: If you don't do it, I will harm you.'

source_sentence: 其人答蛇：『我能為之。』
translation: The man answered the snake, 'I can do it.'

source_sentence: 時蛇將人，共至金所，出金與之，又告之曰：『卿持此金，供養眾僧，設食之日，好念持一阿輸提來，取我舁去。』
translation: The snake then led the man to the gold place, gave him the gold, and told him, 'Take this gold and offer it to the saṃgha; on the day you set out to eat, remember to bring an aśodi to fetch my food and carry it away.'

source_sentence: 其人擔金，至僧伽藍，付僧維那，具以上事，向僧說之，云其毒蛇，欲設供養，剋作食日。
translation: That man carried the gold to Saṃghârāma and told Śrīvana to do the above and tell him about it, saying that it was a viper that he wanted to make offerings to and serve as food on the day of feeding.

source_sentence: 僧受其金為設美饍，作食日至，其人持一小阿輸提，往至蛇所，蛇見其人，心懷歡喜，慰喻問訊，即盤其身，上阿輸提。
translation: When the monk accepted his gold and prepared a delicious meal for him, he took a small aśodi and went to the snake. When the snake saw him, it was delighted and greeted him with words of comfort.

source_sentence: 於是其人，以疊覆上，擔向佛圖。
translation: He then covered it with a heap and carried it toward the Buddha image.

source_sentence: 道逢一人，問擔蛇人：『汝從何來？
translation: When he met a man on the road, he asked the snake-carrier, 'Where did you come from?'

source_sentence: 體履佳不？』
translation: Is it good?

source_sentence: 其人默然不答彼問，再三問之不出一言，所持毒蛇，即便瞋恚，含毒熾盛，欲殺其人，還自遏折。
translation: When he asks again and again, he doesn't say a word, and the viper he's holding becomes angry and blazes with venom, wants to kill him, and then restrains himself.

source_sentence: 復自思念：『云何此人？
translation: Again, he thinks to himself, 'What about this person?'

source_sentence: 不知時宜，他以好意，問訊進止，鄭重三問，無一言答，何可疾耶？』
translation: He didn't know the right time, but he asked three solemn questions about his progress and demise with good intentions, and nothing was said in reply.

source_sentence: 作是念已，毒心復興，隆猛內發，復欲害之。
translation: After that thought, his poisonous thoughts resurface, and he rouses his inner fierceness, wanting to harm him again.

source_sentence: 臨當吐毒，復自思惟：『此人為我作福，未有恩報。』
translation: When he's about to spit out the poison, he thinks to himself, 'This person has done good for me, and I haven't received any kindness in return.'

source_sentence: 如是再三，還自奄伏。
translation: After doing so three times, he then subdues himself.

source_sentence: 『此人於我，已有大恩，雖復作罪，事宜忍之。』
translation: 'This person has already shown great kindness to me, so even though I've done another sin, I'll tolerate it.'

source_sentence: 前到空處，蛇語其人：『下我著地。』
translation: Going forward, the snake said to that person, 'Get off me and put me on the ground.'

source_sentence: 窮責極切，囑戒以法。
translation: He was extremely reprimanded and instructed him to observe the precepts.

source_sentence: 其人於是，便自悔責，生謙下心，垂矜一切。
translation: That man then repented himself, became humble, and pitied all of them.

source_sentence: 蛇重囑及：『莫更爾耶！』
translation: The snake repeatedly instructed him, 'Don't do that again!'

source_sentence: 其人擔蛇，至僧伽藍，著眾僧前。
translation: That man carried a snake to Saṃghârāma and put it in front of the monks.

source_sentence: 於時眾僧，食時已到，作行而立。
translation: When the time came for the monks to eat, they were standing in procession.

source_sentence: 蛇令彼人次第賦香，自以信心，視受香者。
translation: The snake told them to confer incense on each other in turn, and he looked at those who received the incense with faith.

source_sentence: 如是盡底，熟看不移，眾僧引行，遶塔周匝，其人捉水，洗眾僧手，蛇懷敬意，觀洗手人，無有厭心。
translation: After he had done so, he looked at them intently and didn't move. The monks led him on a procession around the stūpa, and he grabbed some water and washed the monks' hands.

source_sentence: 眾僧食訖，重為其蛇，廣為說法。
translation: When the monks had finished eating, they again gave the serpent a detailed explanation of the teaching.

source_sentence: 蛇倍歡喜，更增施心，將僧維那，到本金所，殘金六瓶，盡用施僧。
translation: The snake was doubly delighted, and with an added sense of generosity, he took the saṃgha and went to the main gold store and gave the saṃgha all six vials of gold that were left over.

source_sentence: 作福已訖，便取命終，由其福德，生忉利天。」
translation: After he had made his merit, he then took his life and was born in the Heaven of Thirty-three because of his merit."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「欲知爾時擔蛇人者，豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Would you like to know if that person carrying the snake was someone else?

source_sentence: 則我身是。
translation: "Then I am this body.

source_sentence: 時毒蛇者，今舍利弗是。
translation: The viper of that time is now Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 我乃往日擔蛇之時，為蛇見責，慚愧立誓，生謙下心，等視一切，未曾中退，乃至今日。」
translation: When I was carrying that snake in the past, I was rebuked by the snake's view, made a conscience vow, became humble, looked at everything equally, and never retreated, even today."

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，阿難之等，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The monks, Ānanda and the others who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: （一九）◎差摩現報品第十九(丹本為二十四)
translation: （The Nineteenth Chapter of the Present Repercussions of Cāmu (Danben: 24)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛住羅閱祇竹林精舍，與尊弟子無央數眾。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at the Rājagṛha bamboo grove monastery with an uncountable number of his venerable disciples.

source_sentence: 爾時國中，有一婆羅門，居貧窮困，乏於錢穀，勤加不懈，衰禍遂甚，方宜理盡，衣食不供，便行問人：「今此世間，作何等行，令人現世蒙賴其福？」
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa in that country who lived in poverty and destitution, lacked money and grain, and worked tirelessly, but his misfortune became severe, and when it was time to finish his studies, he went without food or clothing and asked, "What actions in this world will make people rely on their merit in the present life?"

source_sentence: 有人答言：「汝不知耶？
translation: Someone replied, "Don't you know?

source_sentence: 今佛出世，福度眾生，祐利一切，無不得度。
translation: Now, when the Buddha comes into the world, he blesses and benefits all sentient beings, and there's nothing that can't be saved.

source_sentence: 如來復有四尊弟子，摩訶迦葉、大目犍連、舍利弗、阿那律等斯四賢士，每哀貧乏，常行福利苦厄眾生。
translation: Again, the Tathāgata has four honored disciples, Mahākāśyapa, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Śāriputra, and Aniruddha, who are always acting to benefit suffering and distressed sentient beings while sympathizing with the poor.

source_sentence: 汝今若能以信敬心，設食供養此諸賢士，則可現世稱汝所願。」
translation: Now, if you can offer food to these good men with faith and respect, then you can have your wishes fulfilled in the present life."

source_sentence: 時婆羅門，聞諸人所說如是事已，心懷歡喜，往其國中，遍行自衒，作役其身，得少財物，擔至其家，施設飲食，請諸賢聖，供養一日，剋心精勤，望現世報。
translation: After hearing these things from those people, the Brāhmaṇa, rejoicing in his heart, went to his country, went around, showed himself off, worked on his body, obtained a little property, carried it to his house, provided food and drink, invited the good men and sages to offer it to him for a day, and worked hard with the hope of a worldly reward.

source_sentence: 婆羅門婦，字曰差摩(晉言安隱)，飯僧已訖，諸尊弟子，勸請差摩，受八關齋，受齋已訖，各還精舍。
translation: When the Brāhmaṇa woman, whose name was Cāmā (Jin word for peace), had finished feeding the monks, the venerable disciples encouraged Cāmā to accept the eight precepts, and after accepting the precepts, they each returned to the monastery.

source_sentence: 時瓶沙王，值遊林澤還來向城，道見一人，犯王重罪，縛著標頭，竪在道邊，見王悲哀，求索少食；王情愍傷，即可當與，正爾別去。
translation: It was then that the king of Vibhāṣā returned to the city after a trip to the forest and saw a man who had committed a serious crime against the king, tied his head and was standing by the side of the road, who looked at the king in pity and asked for a little food.

source_sentence: 時王竟日，忽忘前事，夜卒自念：「我以先許彼罪人食，云何欻忘？」
translation: After a few days, the king suddenly forgot what had happened before, and at night he went down thinking to himself, "I promised that offender food, why did I crash and forget?"

source_sentence: 即時遣人致食往與，舉宮內外，無欲往者，咸作是說：「今是夜半，道路恐有猛獸惡鬼羅剎，禍難眾多，寧死於此，不能去也。」
translation: He then sent someone to bring food to them, and both inside and outside the palace, no one who wished to go there said, "It's the middle of the night, and the roads are fraught with fears of fierce animals, evil spirits, and rājasas, and numerous misfortunes; they'd rather die here than go."

source_sentence: 爾時國王，念彼人苦，身心煩惱，極懷憐愍，即令國中：「誰能致食至彼人所，賞金千兩。」
translation: At the time, the king, mindful of their suffering and physical and mental distress, took pity on them and ordered the people of the kingdom, "Whoever brings food to that person's place will be rewarded a thousand taels of gold."

source_sentence: 國中人民，無受募者。
translation: None of the people in the kingdom accepted the offer.

source_sentence: 於時差摩，常聞人說：「若世有人，受持八關齋者，眾邪惡鬼，毒獸之類，一切惡災，無能傷害。」
translation: At the time, Caitra always heard people say, "If there's someone in the world who observes the eight precepts, many evil spirits, venomous animals, and all kinds of bad disasters won't be able to harm them."

source_sentence: 差摩聞之，便興此心：「我家貧窮，加復受齋，今王所募，欲為我耳，我今當往受其募直。」
translation: Hearing this, Caitra then had this thought, "My family is poor, and I've had to observe the eight precepts again.

source_sentence: 思惟已定，往應王募。
translation: After he had concentrated on that thought, he went to accept the king's invitation.

source_sentence: 爾時國王，又語差摩：「為吾擔食，至彼人所，若達來還，吾定當與汝金千兩。」
translation: It was then that the king also said to Cāmā, "Carry my food to that person's place, and if you reach them and return, I will surely give you a thousand taels of gold."

source_sentence: 差摩即時，如勅擔往，至心持齋，無有缺失，順道而行。
translation: Śākya then carried them as ordered, wholeheartedly observed the meal without fail, and followed the path.

source_sentence: 出城漸遠，逢一羅剎，名曰藍婆。
translation: As he left the city and traveled farther and farther, he came upon a Rāṣṭrapāla named Rāmaputta.

source_sentence: 彼鬼是時，生五百子，初生已竟，極懷飢渴，見差摩來，望以為食。
translation: That demon had given birth to 500 sons, and after they were first born, they were so hungry and thirsty that they saw Caitra coming and wanted to feed them.

source_sentence: 然彼差摩，持齋無缺，羅剎見之，逆懷怖畏，飢餓所逼，現身從乞所擔之食，持少施我。
translation: However, that poor soul observes purification without fail, and when the rājasas see him, they are rebelliously frightened and driven by hunger, so they present themselves to solicit the food they're carrying and give it to me in small portions.

source_sentence: 差摩不逆，以少匃之，所施雖少，鬼神力故，而用飽滿。
translation: The poor man didn't oppose it and gave him a little bit of food, but even though it was small, the ghosts filled it up with power.

source_sentence: 於時羅剎，問差摩言：「汝字何等？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla then asked Cāmā, "What's your letter?"

source_sentence: 女人答言：「我字差摩。」
translation: The woman answered, "My name is Cāmā."

source_sentence: 羅剎歡喜，語差摩言：「今我分身，而得安隱，由卿活命，益我不少，我既蒙活，復聞好字，我所住處，有一釜金，持以報卿，來時念取。」
translation: Rejoicing, Rāṣṭrapāla said to Kāśyapa, "Now, I've been parted and have attained peace because you've helped me a great deal by keeping me alive. I've been kept alive and I've heard good words.

source_sentence: 又復問言：「汝欲何至？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Where do you want to go?"

source_sentence: 差摩答言：「欲持此食往與彼人。」
translation: Kṣama replied, "I'd like to take this food and give it to that person."

source_sentence: 藍婆又言：「我有女妹，在前住止，字阿藍婆，卿若見之，為吾問訊，云我分身，生五百子，身體安隱，具騰我情，令知消息。」
translation: Rāmaputta also said, "I have a sister staying here named Rāmaputta. If you see her, ask her about me, saying that she's part of my body, that she's given birth to 500 sons, that she's physically peaceful, and that she gives rise to my feelings and makes them known."

source_sentence: 差摩如言，順道而去。
translation: According to his words, Kālāma followed the path.

source_sentence: 見阿藍婆，即出問訊，說其藍婆，情事委曲，生五百子，皆悉安隱。
translation: When he saw Ārāḍa, he went out to greet him and told him that Ārāḍa was troubled by his situation and had given birth to 500 sons, all of whom were at peace.

source_sentence: 時阿藍婆，聞之歡喜，問婦人曰：「今汝字何？」
translation: The Ārāḍa then rejoiced when he heard that, and asked the woman, "What's your name now?"

source_sentence: 女人答言：「我字差摩。」
translation: The woman replied, "My name is Chama."

source_sentence: 羅剎聞之，亦用歡悅。
translation: When the Rāṣṭrapāla heard this, he, too, rejoiced.

source_sentence: 「我姊分身，復得安隱，汝字復好，何其善也！
translation: "How nice it is that my sister's separate body has been made secure again and that your name is good again!

source_sentence: 今此住處，有一釜金，我用賜卿，來時念取。」
translation: Now, at this place, there's a caldron of gold that I'm giving you, so remember to take it when you come."

source_sentence: 又問之曰：「汝欲何至？」
translation: He also asked him, "Where do you want it?"

source_sentence: 差摩答言：「為王擔食，至彼人所。」
translation: Kṣama answered, "I carried food for the king to that person's place."

source_sentence: 阿藍婆曰：「我有一弟，字分那奇，住在前路，為吾問訊，因騰姊意。」
translation: Alamba said, "I have a brother named Pūrṇacī who lives up the road and asks about me because I want to hear from you."

source_sentence: 即復共辭，順道而進。
translation: They then took their leave together and went down the road.

source_sentence: 到前如意，見分那奇，為其二姊，具說意狀，云彼大姊，生五百子，身輕安隱，無有不祥。
translation: When they arrived, they saw Fennec and explained the wishes of his two sisters, saying that their oldest sister had given birth to 500 sons who were light and peaceful and had no misfortune.

source_sentence: 時分那奇，聞其二姊平安消息，心用歡喜、復問差摩：「汝字何等？」
translation: When Pūrṇa Ki heard that his two sisters were safe, he rejoiced at heart and asked Śākya Mahā, "What's your name?"

source_sentence: 婦人答曰：「我字差摩。」
translation: The woman replied, "My name is Chama."

source_sentence: 其鬼答言：「汝字安隱，復傳我姊平安消息，倍何快耶？」
translation: The ghost replied, "How much more pleasant it is for you to convey news of my sister's safety, given your name, Aniruddha?"

source_sentence: 即語差摩言：「我此住處，有金一釜，以用遺卿，來時念取。」
translation: He then told Cāmu, "At my residence here, I have a caldron of gold that I'll leave with you; remember to take it when you come."

source_sentence: 辭別已竟，引路而去。
translation: After he had said goodbye, he led the way and departed.

source_sentence: 憶識故處，至彼人所，與食已訖，還來本處，取金三釜持至其家，復於王家，得賞金千兩，其家於是，拔貧即富。
translation: After recollecting his old place, he went to that person, gave them food, returned to his original place, took three caldrons of gold, took them to his house, and returned to the king's house, where he was rewarded with a thousand taels of gold; his family was then pulled out of poverty and became wealthy.

source_sentence: 國中庶民見其家內財寶饒多各各慕及，樂為營從，來至其家，承給使令。
translation: Seeing the wealth and possessions of that man's household, each of the country's common people admired him and happily worked for their benefit, coming to his house to accept his orders.

source_sentence: 王聞是人福德如是，即召至宮，拜為大臣。
translation: When the king heard of this man's virtue, he summoned him to his palace and made him a minister.

source_sentence: 既蒙王祿，其家又富，信心誠篤廣殖福業，請佛及僧，施設大檀。
translation: Once he had received the king's salary and his family was wealthy, he had sincere faith and a large amount of merit, and invited the Buddha and his saṃgha to offer them a great donation.

source_sentence: 佛與徒眾，悉受其請。
translation: The Buddha and his disciples all accepted his invitation.

source_sentence: 飲食已訖，佛為說法，心意開解，成須陀洹。
translation: After they finished eating, the Buddha preached the Dharma for them, and their minds were liberated as they became stream-winners.

source_sentence: 時諸會者，阿難之等，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: The assembled people, including Ānanda, who heard what the Buddha taught, rejoiced and approved.

source_sentence: （二〇）◎貧女難陀品第二十(丹本此品在第十一卷為五十三)
translation: (20) -Nanda the Poor Girl Chapter 20 (The Dan edition of this chapter is number fifty-three in Book 11)

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時國中，有一女人名曰難陀，貧窮孤獨，乞匃自活。
translation: At the time, there was a woman named Nandha in that country who was poor and alone, begging for alms to support herself.

source_sentence: 見諸國王臣民大小，各各供養佛及眾僧，心自思惟：「我之宿罪，生處貧賤，雖遭福田，無有種子。」
translation: Seeing the king, his subjects, and his subjects, large and small, each making offerings to the Buddha and the saṃgha, she thought to herself, "My past transgressions have led me to be born in a poor and disadvantaged place, and even though I've been blessed with a field of merit, I have no seeds."

source_sentence: 酸切感傷，深自咎悔，便行乞匃，以俟微供。
translation: Saddened and deeply remorseful, they then begged for alms in order to make a modest offering.

source_sentence: 竟日不休，唯得一錢，持詣油家，欲用買油。
translation: After several days of incessant begging, he managed to get only one coin, which he took to an oilman's house to buy oil.

source_sentence: 油家問曰：「一錢買油，少無所逮，用作何等？」
translation: The oil man asked, "A penny's worth of oil is a small amount, so what will it do?"

source_sentence: 難陀具以所懷語之。
translation: Nandha told him exactly what he had in mind.

source_sentence: 油主憐愍，增倍與油。
translation: The oil lord took pity on him and doubled the amount of oil he gave.

source_sentence: 得已歡喜，足作一燈，擔向精舍，奉上世尊，置於佛前眾燈之中，自立誓願：「我今貧窮，用是小燈，供養於佛。
translation: Rejoicing in his success, he made a single lamp with his feet, carried it to the monastery, presented it to the Bhagavān, placed it among the many lamps in front of the Buddha, and made a vow, "Now, I'm poor, and I'll use this small lamp to make offerings to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 以此功德，令我來世得智慧照，滅除一切眾生垢闇。」
translation: Because of this merit, I'll attain wisdom and illumination in the next life, and I'll extinguish the defiling darkness of all sentient beings."

source_sentence: 作是誓已，禮佛而去。
translation: After making this vow, he paid homage to the Buddha and departed.

source_sentence: 乃至夜竟，諸燈盡滅，唯此獨燃。
translation: When the night was over, all the lamps went out except for this one, which was lit alone.

source_sentence: 是時目連，次當日直，察天已曉，收燈摒擋，見此一燈，獨燃明好，膏炷未損，如新燃燈，心便生念：「白日燃燈，無益時用。
translation: When Mucilin next stood up at sunrise, he noticed that it was dawn, put away his lamp, and put it away. Seeing this one lamp, burning brightly and well alone, with its oil and wick undiminished, like a newly lit lamp, he thought, "Burning a lamp in the daytime isn't helpful for timely use.

source_sentence: 欲取滅之，暮規還燃。」
translation: I'd like to get rid of it, but it'll burn again at night."

source_sentence: 即時舉手，扇滅此燈，燈焰如故，無有虧滅；復以衣扇，燈明不損。
translation: Immediately, he raised his hand and fanned the lamp to extinguish it, but the flame remained the same without loss; he also fanned it with his robe, and the lamp's brightness wasn't diminished.

source_sentence: 佛見目連欲滅此燈，語目連曰：「今此燈者，非汝聲聞所能傾動，正使汝注四大海水，以用灌之，隨嵐風吹，亦不能滅。
translation: When the Buddha saw that Maudgalyāyana wanted to extinguish the lamp, he said to Maudgalyāyana, "Now, this lamp is not something that śrāvakas can tilt, but even if you were to pour four large bodies of water into it and fill it with water, it wouldn't go out even if the wind blew in the wind.

source_sentence: 所以爾者？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此是廣濟，發大心人所施之物。」
translation: These are the things that are given by people who have a great intention to help extensively."

source_sentence: 佛說是已，難陀女人，復來詣佛頭面作禮，於時世尊，即授其記：「汝於來世二阿僧祇百劫之中，當得作佛，名曰燈光，十號具足。」
translation: After the Buddha said this, the Nandanavana woman again bowed head to head to the Buddha, and the Bhagavān then gave her this assurance: "In the next two incalculable and one hundred eons, you will become a buddha named Dōkyō, and your ten epithets will be complete."

source_sentence: 於是難陀，得記歡喜，長跪白佛，求索出家。
translation: Nandha then rejoiced at the assurance, knelt down long and said to the Buddha, "I beg you to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即聽之，作比丘尼。
translation: The Buddha then listened to him and made him a nun.

source_sentence: 慧命阿難、目連，見貧女人得免苦厄出家受記，長跪合掌，前白佛言：「難陀女人，宿有何行，經爾許時，貧乞自活？
translation: Wise men Ānanda and Maudgalyāyana, seeing that a poor woman had been freed from suffering and hardship and had left home to receive assurance of ordination, knelt down long and joined their palms as they approached the Buddha, saying, "Nandha, what were your past deeds, woman, that after all this time you've been poor and begged for your own life?

source_sentence: 復因何行，值佛出家，四輩欽仰諍求供養？」
translation: What other practice led to the Buddha's renunciation from the world and the four groups of people who respect him and seek his offerings?"

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「過去有佛，名曰迦葉。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "There once was a Buddha named Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 爾時世中，有居士婦，躬往請佛及比丘僧，然佛先已可一貧女，受其供養，此女已得阿那含道。
translation: At the time, there was a householder woman who personally went to invite the Buddha and the monks, but the Buddha had previously accepted an offering from a poor woman who had already attained the path of non-returners.

source_sentence: 時長者婦，自以財富，輕忽貧者，嫌佛世尊先受其請，便復言曰：『世尊云何不受我供，乃先應彼乞人請也？』
translation: The elderly woman, despising the poor man because of her wealth, resented the fact that the Bhagavān had first accepted her invitation, and then she said, 'Bhagavān, why didn't you accept my offerings when you first responded to that beggar's invitation?'

source_sentence: 以其惡言，輕忽賢聖，從是以來，五百世中，恒生貧賤乞匃之家。
translation: Because of their harsh words, they despised the good and the noble, and since then, for five hundred generations, they've always been born into a poor and beggarly family.

source_sentence: 由其彼日供養如來及於眾僧，敬心歡喜，今值佛世，出家受記，合國欽仰。」
translation: Because they had supported the Tathāgata and the saṃgha on those days and rejoiced with respect and heart, they now come into the Buddha's world, leave home, receive assurance of ordination, and are held in high esteem by the entire nation."

source_sentence: 爾時眾會，聞佛說此已，皆大歡喜。
translation: After hearing this from the Buddha, the congregation was overjoyed.

source_sentence: 國王臣民，聞此貧女奉上一燈受記作佛，皆發欽仰，並各施與上妙衣服，四事無乏。
translation: When the king and his subjects heard that this poor woman had dedicated her life to the One Lamp and received assurance of becoming a Buddha, they all roused their admiration and gave each of them fine clothing and four things without fail.

source_sentence: 合國男女，尊卑大小，競共設作諸香油燈，持詣祇洹，供養於佛。
translation: The men and women of the kingdom, both noble and great, worked together to build scented oil lamps, carried them to Jetavana, and offered them to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 眾人猥多，燈滿祇洹，諸樹林中，四匝彌滿，猶如眾星列在空中，日日如是，經於七夜。
translation: The multitude was so great that the lamps filled Qipuan and the grove of trees was filled four times, just like the stars in the sky, day after day, for seven nights.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，甚用歡喜，嗟歎如來若干德行，前白佛言：「不審，世尊！
translation: Ānanda then rejoiced greatly, praised the Tathāgata for his many virtues, and said to the Buddha, "I don't think so, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 過去世中，作何善根，致斯無極燈供果報？」
translation: What good roots did they cultivate in past lives that brought about the result of this supreme offering of lamps?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「過去久遠二阿僧祇九十一劫，此閻浮提，有大國王，名波塞奇，主此世界八萬四千諸小國土。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "In the distant past, during two incalculable and ninety-one eons, there was a great king of this Jambudvīpa named Pārśecī who ruled 84,000 small lands in this world.

source_sentence: 王大夫人，生一太子，身紫金色，三十二相、八十種好，當其頂上，有自然寶，眾相晃朗，光曜人目。
translation: The king's great wife gave birth to a crown prince with a purple-gold body, thirty-two features, and eighty beauties, and on top of his head there was a natural treasure with a variety of features that shone brightly and brilliantly for people's eyes.

source_sentence: 即召相師，占相吉凶，因為作字。
translation: He summoned a fortune teller to divine his fortune and fortune, and he had words made for it.

source_sentence: 相師披看，見其奇妙，舉手唱言：『善哉善哉！
translation: When the fortune teller looked at him and saw how wonderful he was, he raised his hand and called out, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 今此太子，於諸世間天人之中無與等者，若其在家，作轉輪聖王，若其出家，成自然佛。』
translation: Now, this prince has no equal among the gods and humans of the world; if he were at home, he'd be a wheel-turning sage king, and if he were to leave home, he'd become a natural Buddha.'

source_sentence: 相師白王：『太子生時，有何異事？』
translation: The fortune teller told the king, 'What was the difference when the prince was born?'

source_sentence: 王答之言：『頂上明寶，自然隨出。』
translation: The king answered him, 'The bright jewel on the top of your head will naturally follow.'

source_sentence: 便為立字字勒那識祇，晉言寶髻。
translation: He then created the Sanskrit word lena consciousness, which is the Jin term for a jeweled topknot.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，出家學道，得成為佛，教化人民，度者甚多。
translation: As he grew older, he left home and trained on the path, became a buddha, taught and educated the people, and saved many of them.

source_sentence: 爾時父王，請佛及僧，三月供養。
translation: It was then that my father the king invited the Buddha and the saṃgha to make offerings for three months.

source_sentence: 有一比丘，字阿梨蜜羅，晉言聖友，保三月中，作燈檀越，日日入城，詣諸長者居士人民，求索蘇油燈炷之具。
translation: In the middle of the third month, a monk named Ārya Maitreya, who is known as the Sacred Friend, became a candle donor and went into the city day after day to visit the elders, householders, and people to ask for oil for lamps and burns.

source_sentence: 時王有女，名曰牟尼，登於高樓，見此比丘日行入城，經營所須，心生敬重，遣人往問：『尊人恒爾勞苦，何所營理？』
translation: The king then had a woman named Muni who had climbed a high building and saw this monk going into the city every day, working on what was needed, and she was so respectful that she sent someone to ask, 'Venerable, what is the reason you're constantly toiling?'

source_sentence: 比丘報言：『我今三月，與佛及僧，作燈檀越，所以入城詣諸賢者，求索蘇油燈炷之具，使還報命。』
translation: The monk reported, 'This past three months, I went into the city with the Buddha and the saṃgha to ask some good men for oil for a lamp, so that I might return the favor.'

source_sentence: 王女歡喜，又語聖友：『自今已往，莫復行乞，我當給汝作燈之具。』
translation: Rejoicing, the king's daughter also said to her noble friend, 'From now on, don't go begging again; I will give you something to use as a lamp.'

source_sentence: 比丘可之。
translation: The monk approved.

source_sentence: 從是已後，常送蘇油燈炷之具，詣於精舍。
translation: From then on, he always sent a supply of oil for a lamp and wick to the monastery.

source_sentence: 聖友比丘，日日經營，燃燈供養，發意廣濟誠心欵著。
translation: The holy friend monk worked day by day, burning his lamp and making offerings, and he sincerely devoted himself to helping others.

source_sentence: 佛授其記：『汝於來世阿僧祇劫，當得作佛，名曰定光，十號具足。』
translation: The Buddha gave him this prediction: 'In the next incalculably long eon, you will become a buddha named Ting-kwong, and your ten epithets will be complete.'

source_sentence: 王女牟尼，聞聖友比丘授記作佛，心自念言：『佛燈之物，悉是我有，比丘經營，今已得記，我獨不得。』
translation: When the king's daughter Muni heard that the noble friend the monk had given her the assurance of becoming a buddha, she thought to herself, 'I own all the things that are the Buddha's lamp, and the monk who operates them has now obtained their assurance, but I alone won't get it.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，往詣佛所，自陳所懷。
translation: After that thought, he went to the Buddha and told him what he had in mind.

source_sentence: 佛復授記，告牟尼曰：『汝於來世二阿僧祇九十一劫，當得作佛，名釋迦牟尼，十號具足。』
translation: The Buddha then authorized her and told Muni, 'In the next two incalculable and ninety-one eons, you will become a buddha named Śākyamuni, complete with the ten epithets.'

source_sentence: 於是王女，聞佛授記，歡喜發中，化成男子，重禮佛足，求為沙門。
translation: Hearing the Buddha's assurance, the king's daughter rejoiced, became a man, paid homage to the Buddha's feet, and asked to become an ascetic.

source_sentence: 佛便聽之，精進勇猛，勤修不息。」
translation: The Buddha then listened, made vigorous effort, and diligently cultivated without stopping."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時比丘阿梨蜜者，豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Was that monk Āryamitra a different person at the time?

source_sentence: 乃往過去定光佛是。
translation: "This is the Buddha of Constant Light from the past.

source_sentence: 王女牟尼，豈異人乎？
translation: Is the king's daughter, Muni, someone else?

source_sentence: 我身是也。
translation: This is my body.

source_sentence: 因由昔日燈明布施，從是已來，無數劫中，天上世間受福自然，身體殊異超絕餘人，至今成佛，故受此諸燈明之報。」
translation: Because of the almsgiving of lamps in the past, since then, for countless eons, I've received natural merit in the heavens and in the world, and my body is exceptional beyond that of other people, and I've become a buddha since then, I've received the rewards of these lamps."

source_sentence: 時諸大會聞佛所說，有得初果乃至四果，或種緣覺善根之者，有發無上正真道意。
translation: The assembled had heard what the Buddha had taught, and some had attained the first realization up to the fourth realization, or some had planted the wholesome roots of pratyekabuddhas and had arisen the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 慧命阿難，及諸眾會，咸共頂戴，踊躍奉行。
translation: Wise Life Ānanda and the assembly all shared their respect and enthusiastically approved of their practice.

source_sentence: ◎賢愚經卷第三（二一）◎大光明王始發道心緣品第十六有知慧巧便人，以小緣故，能發大心趣向佛道；懈怠懶惰人，雖有大緣，猶不發意趣向佛道。
translation: Śrīmālā-sūtra, Volume 3 (21) Śrīmālā-sūtra, Chapter 16: The Conditions for Beginning to Awaken the Mind for the Path There are people who know that wisdom and skillful means can cause great intentions to head for the Buddha's path because of small conditions, but lazy people still don't cause intentions to head for the Buddha's path even though they have great conditions.

source_sentence: 是故行者，應強心立志勇猛善緣，何以知然？
translation: Therefore, practitioners should strengthen their minds and set their intentions to boldly and well conditioned.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園，與諸四眾諸王臣民，前後圍遶，供養恭敬。
translation: The Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī with four crowds of kings and their subjects, surrounded by them in front and behind, making offerings and venerating them.

source_sentence: 於是眾中，多有疑者：「世尊，本以何因緣故？
translation: Many of those in the crowd wondered, "Bhagavān, what were the causes and conditions for this?

source_sentence: 初發無上菩提之心，自致成佛，多所利益？
translation: What is the benefit of the first arousal of the intention for unsurpassed enlightenment, which brings about the Buddhahood of oneself?

source_sentence: 我等亦當發心成道利安眾生。」
translation: We too will arouse the intention to achieve the great way for the benefit and welfare of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 尊者阿難，知眾所念，即從坐起整衣服，前白佛言：「今此大眾，咸皆有疑：『世尊本昔從何因緣，發大道心？
translation: Knowing what they were thinking, Venerable Ānanda rose from his seat and adjusted his robes as he approached the Buddha, saying, "Now, this is a large group of people who all have doubts, 'What were the causes for the Bhagavān's having the great intention to achieve the Way in the past?'

source_sentence: 唯願說之，廣利一切。』」
translation: Please let it be taught for the broad benefit of all people.'"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝所問者，多所饒益。
translation: Whatever you ask, it will often be helpful.

source_sentence: 諦聽善思！
translation: Listen closely and well consider it!

source_sentence: 當為汝說。」
translation: I will explain this for you."

source_sentence: 時大會，寂靜無聲，風河江水，百鳥走獸，皆寂無聲，於是大眾，天龍鬼神，悚然樂聞，一心觀佛。
translation: When the assembly was silent, the winds, rivers, waters, and a hundred birds and animals were all still and silent, the great crowd, gods, dragons, and spirits were frightened and happy to hear them, and they concentrated on the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「過去久遠，無量無邊阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有一大王，名大光明，有大福德，聰明勇慧，王相具足。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "Once upon a time in the distant past, in an incalculably long and limitless incalculable eon, there was a great king of Yambudvīpa who was named Great Light, had great merit, intelligence, courage, and wisdom, and whose kingly characteristics were complete.

source_sentence: 爾時邊境，有一國王，與為親厚。
translation: At the time, there was a king at a border who was close to that country.

source_sentence: 彼國所乏，大光明王，隨時贈送；彼國所珍，亦復奉獻於光明王。
translation: The king of great radiance readily gave away what that country lacked, and he also presented the treasures of that country to the king of radiance.

source_sentence: 時彼國王，大山遊獵，得二象子，端正姝妙，白如玻[王*(黍-禾+利)]山，七支拄地，甚可敬愛，心喜念言：『我今當以與光明王。』
translation: The king of that country was hunting on a large mountain when he found two elephant children, beautiful and pure, white as a glass [king * (millet - grain + profit)] mountain, with seven limbs supporting the ground, and very desirable, and he rejoiced in his heart and thought, 'Now, I will give them to King Shining Light.'

source_sentence: 念已莊校，金銀雜寶，極世之珍，遣人往送。
translation: After he had finished recollecting it, he adorned it with gold, silver, and other treasures of the highest order and sent someone to deliver it to him.

source_sentence: 時光明王，見此象已，心大欣悅。
translation: When he saw this elephant, King Shining Light was overjoyed.

source_sentence: 時有象師，名曰散闍，王即告言：『汝教此象，瞻養令調。』
translation: Then there was an elephant master named Sanjar, and the king told him, 'Teach this elephant to nurture and train itself.'

source_sentence: 散闍奉教不久調順，眾寶交絡，往白王言：『我所調象，今已調良，願王觀試。』
translation: Soon after he was taught to tame it, Sanjar, surrounded by treasures, went to the king and said, 'Now that my elephant is in tune, I want the king to examine it.'

source_sentence: 王聞心喜，遲欲見之，即擊金鼓，會諸臣下，令觀試象。
translation: Delighted at what he heard, the king longed to see him, so he beat his golden drum and gathered his ministers together to have the elephant examined.

source_sentence: 大眾既集，王乘是象，譬如日初出山光明照曜，王初乘象，亦復如是。
translation: After the crowd had gathered, the king rode this elephant like the first time the sun rises over a mountain and shines brightly, and so did the king when he first rode the elephant.

source_sentence: 與諸臣民，出城遊戲，將至試所。
translation: He and his subjects left the city to play as they approached the testing site.

source_sentence: 時象氣壯，見有群象於蓮華池食蓮華根，見已欲發奔逐牸象，遂至深林。
translation: When the elephant's energy was strong, he saw a herd of elephants feeding on the lotus root at a lotus pond, and after seeing them, he wanted to run after the elephants, so he went into a deep forest.

source_sentence: 時王冠服，悉皆墮落，壞衣破身，出血牽髮。
translation: The king's crown and robes all fell off, his clothes were torn and his body was torn, and he was bleeding and tugging at his hair.

source_sentence: 王時眩[目*冒]，自惟必死，極懷恐怖，即問象師：『吾寧當有餘命不耶？』
translation: The king was dazed [eyes*breath], thought he was going to die, and was terrified.

source_sentence: 散闍白王：『林中諸樹，有可捉者，願王搏捉，乃可得全。』
translation: Sahassākkha said to the king, 'May the king wrestle one of the trees in the forest that can be caught, so that he can get it back intact.'

source_sentence: 王搏樹枝，象去王住，下樹坐地，自視無復衣冠，身體傷破，生大苦惱，迷悶出林，不知從者所在。
translation: The king wrestled the branch of the tree, and when the elephant left the king's residence, he got down from the tree and sat down on the ground. He looked at himself, saw that he didn't have his robe back on, his body was broken, and he became very distressed and went out of the forest in confusion, not knowing where he had followed him.

source_sentence: 象師小前，捉樹得住，還求見王愁惱獨坐，象師叩頭，白王：『願王莫大憂苦，此象正爾婬心當息，厭惡穢草，不甘濁水，思宮清淨肥美飲食，如是自還。』
translation: The elephant maker bowed his head and said to the king, 'May the king not be greatly distressed and distressed, for this elephant is a correct example of a man whose lustful mind must be stopped, who hates filthy grass and dislikes impure water, and who wants to return to his palace with a clean, fat diet.'

source_sentence: 王即告曰：『吾今不復思汝及象，以此象故，幾失吾命。』
translation: The king then told them, 'Now, I won't think about you and the elephant anymore, for this elephant has almost cost me my life.'

source_sentence: 爾時群臣，咸各生念，謂王已為狂象所害。
translation: It was then that a group of ministers each became mindful that the king had been harmed by the mad elephant.

source_sentence: 尋路推求處處，或得天冠衣服，或見落血，遂乃見王，駕乘餘象，還來入城。
translation: They looked for a way out, searched everywhere, and found either a crown of heavenly robes or a fallen body of blood, and then they saw the king riding the other elephant back into the city.

source_sentence: 城中人民，悉見大王受如是苦，莫不憂惱。
translation: When the people of the city saw that the king was suffering like that, none of them were distressed.

source_sentence: 爾時狂象，在野澤中，食諸惡草，飲濁穢水，婬欲意息，即思王宮清涼甘饍，行如疾風，詣本止處。
translation: At the time, the crazy elephant was in a wild swamp, eating bad grass and drinking filthy water, and his lustful desires subsided.

source_sentence: 象師見已，往白王言：『大王當知！
translation: After he saw this, the elephant master went to the king and said, 'You must know, Great King!

source_sentence: 先所失象，今還來至，願王視之。』
translation: Now, I'd like the king to look at the elephant I lost earlier and return it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『我不須汝，亦不須象。』
translation: The king said, 'I don't need you, and I don't need the elephant.'

source_sentence: 散闍啟王：『王若不須我及象者，唯願觀我調象之方。』
translation: Sañjaya then asked the king, 'If the king doesn't need me or the elephant, just look at the way I trained the elephant.'

source_sentence: 王即使於平坦地敷置坐處。
translation: The king then spread out his sitting place on a level surface.

source_sentence: 「時國中人，聞此象師欲示大王調象之法，普皆雲集。
translation: "When the people of the kingdom heard that this elephant master wanted to show the king the way to tame elephants, they all gathered in great crowds.

source_sentence: 時王出宮，大眾導從，詣座而坐，象師散闍，將象至會，尋使工師，作七鐵丸，燒令極赤，作已念言：『象吞此丸，決定當死；王後或悔。』
translation: When the king left the palace and the crowd followed him, he sat down at his seat, and the elephant master scattered the jhāna, brought the elephant to the assembly, had a worker make seven iron balls, burned them until they were perfectly red, and said after he made them, 'When the elephant swallows this, it will surely die; the king may regret it afterward.'

source_sentence: 白言大王：『此白象寶，唯轉輪王，乃得之耳，今有小過，不應喪失。』
translation: He said to the king, 'Only the wheel-turning king has access to this white elephant treasure, and now there's a small mistake that shouldn't be lost.'

source_sentence: 王告之言：『象若不調，不應令吾乘之；若其調適，事釁如斯。
translation: The king told him, 'If the elephant wasn't in tune, I wouldn't have been allowed to ride it; if it had been in tune, things would have turned out like this.

source_sentence: 今不須汝，亦不須象。』
translation: Now, you are not needed, and neither is the elephant needed.'

source_sentence: 象師又言：『雖不須我，象甚可惜！』
translation: The elephant master also said, 'Although I'm not needed, it's a great pity about the elephant!'

source_sentence: 王怒隆盛，告言遠去！
translation: The king's anger grew, and he told them to go away!

source_sentence: 散闍起已，泣淚而言：『王無親踈，其心如毒，詐出甜言。』
translation: When he got up, Sanjar wept and said, 'The king has no relatives, and his heart is like poison; he lies and speaks sweetly.'

source_sentence: 時會大小，聞已墮淚，諦視於象。
translation: After hearing this, the assembly members burst into tears and looked closely at the elephant.

source_sentence: 象師即便作相告象：『吞此鐵丸，若不吞者，當以鐵鉤斵裂汝腦。』
translation: Even as he did so, the elephant master told the elephant, 'Swallow this iron ball; if you don't, an iron hook will be used to split your brain.'

source_sentence: 象知其心，即自思惟：『我寧吞此熱丸而死，實不堪忍被鐵鉤死，如人俱死，寧受絞死不樂燒殺。』
translation: Knowing his thoughts, the elephant then thought to himself, 'I'd rather swallow this hot ball and die; I really couldn't bear to die by an iron hook; like a person dying together, I'd rather be hanged than burned to death.'

source_sentence: 屈膝向王，垂淚望救。
translation: He bent his knees to the king and looked up in tears for help.

source_sentence: 王意怒盛，覩已餘視。
translation: The king's anger was intense, and he looked away after he saw him.

source_sentence: 散闍告象：『汝今何以不吞此丸？』
translation: Sanjar told the elephant, 'Why didn't you swallow this pill now?'

source_sentence: 時象四顧，念是眾中，乃無有能救我命者，以手取丸，置口吞之，入腹焦爛，直過而死，如金剛杵打玻[王*(黍-禾+利)]山，鐵丸墮地，猶故熱赤。
translation: The elephant then looked around and thought, "Is there no one among them who can save my life?" He took the ball in his hand, put it in his mouth, swallowed it, and it burned inside his belly and killed him like a vajra pounder striking a [king*(millet-grass+leaves)] mountain, and the iron ball fell to the ground, but it was still hot and red.

source_sentence: 時會見已，莫不悲泣。
translation: When the congregation saw this, they all wept with sorrow.

source_sentence: 「王見此事，驚怖愕然，乃生悔心，即召散闍，告言：『汝象調順乃爾，何故在林，不能制之？』
translation: "When the king saw this, he was shocked and startled, and then he repented. He summoned Sanjar and told him, 'Is your elephant so well adjusted that you can't restrain it while it's in the forest?'

source_sentence: 時淨居天，知光明王應發無上菩提之心，即作神力，令象師跪答王言：『大王！
translation: Knowing that the king of light should arouse the intention for unsurpassed enlightenment, the Vaiśravaṇa gods then exerted their supernormal powers and caused the elephant masters to kneel down and answer the king, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我唯能調象身，不能調心。』
translation: I can only tame the elephant body, not the mind.'

source_sentence: 王即問言：『頗復有人，亦能調身，兼調心不？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Could there be another person who can tame the body and tame the mind at the same time?'

source_sentence: 白言大王：『有佛世尊！
translation: He said, "Great king, 'There is the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 既能調身，亦能調心。』
translation: As he can tame the body, he can also tame the mind.'

source_sentence: 時光明王，聞佛名已，心驚毛竪，告言散闍：『所言佛者，何種性生？』
translation: Upon hearing the Buddha's name, the king of light was startled, and his hair stood on end as he told Sanskrit, 'What kind of nature does that person who says he's a Buddha have?'

source_sentence: 散闍答言：『佛世尊者，二種性生，一者智慧，二者大悲。
translation: Sañjaya replied, 'The Bhagavān is born of two natures, one of wisdom and the other of great compassion.

source_sentence: 勤行六事，所謂六波羅蜜，功德智慧，悉具足已，號之為佛，既自能調，亦調眾生。』
translation: After diligently performing the six tasks, which are called the six perfections, and having fully acquired their virtues and wisdom, he's called a buddha who is able to tame himself and tame sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 王聞是已，悚然踊躍，即起入宮，洗浴香湯，更著新衣，上高閣上，四向作禮，於一切眾生起大悲心，燒香誓願：『願我所有功德，迴向佛道，我成佛已，自調其心，亦當調伏一切眾生。
translation: After hearing this, the king was startled and roused, so he got up and went into the palace, washed himself in scented baths, put on new robes, went up to a high tower, paid homage in all directions, aroused great compassion for all sentient beings, burned incense, and vowed, 'May all my merits be directed toward the Buddha Way, and after I become a buddha and tame my own mind, I will also tame all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若以一眾生故，在於阿鼻地獄，住經一劫，有所益者，當入是獄，終不捨於菩提之心。』
translation: If I were to stay in the avīci hell for an eon because of one sentient being and get any benefit, I would enter that hell and never abandon the mind of enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 作是誓已，六種震動，諸山大海，[跳-兆+叵][跳-兆+我]踊沒，虛空之中，自然樂聲，無量諸天，作天妓樂，歌歎菩薩，而作是言：『如汝所作，得佛不久；成佛道已，願度我等，我等於此清淨法會，亦應有分。』」
translation: After making this vow, six kinds of earthquakes shook the mountains and seas, [jumping - trillion + ungodly] [jumping - trillion + self] rushed in, and in the sky there was a natural sound of music, and measureless gods made divine music and sang the praises of the bodhisattvas, saying, 'Just as you did, you won't be able to become a buddha anytime soon; after you achieve the buddha path and wish to save us, we should also have a part in this pure Dharma assembly.'"

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知爾時白象吞鐵丸者，難陀是也。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You want to know about the white elephant who swallowed the iron ball at the time, Nanda!

source_sentence: 時象師者，舍利弗是也。
translation: The elephant master of that time was Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 光明王者，我身是也。
translation: The man who was the king of light was me.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，見是象調順故，始發道心，求於佛道。」
translation: It was then that I saw this elephant in tune with me and began to arouse the attitude of enlightenment and seek the Buddha's path."

source_sentence: 爾時大會，聞佛苦行如是，有得四道果者，有發大道心者，有出家修道者，莫不歡喜，頂戴奉行。
translation: At the time, the great assembly of people who heard about the Buddha's ascetic practices in this way, some who had attained the fruit of the four paths, some who had arisen the mind for the great way, and some who had left home and cultivated it, were all encouraged, honored, and approved.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，強志勇故，由小因緣能辦大事；懶惰懈怠，雖遇大緣，無所能成。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, a strong will and courageous effort can accomplish great things from minor causes; when they're lazy and careless, they'll encounter great causes but be unable to achieve them.

source_sentence: 是故行者，當勤精進趣向佛道。
translation: Therefore, practitioners should diligently apply themselves to the Buddha Way.
